text: The voiced uvular lateral fricative is a type of consonantal sound, used in some spoken languages, such as English or Spanish. The symbol in the International Phonetic Alphabet that represents the sound is 〈ʟ̠˔〉. The equivalent X-SAMPA symbol is `Q\`. The sound has a consonant transcribed (ա). The Armenian letter Ayb. == Features == Features of the voiced uvular lateral fricative: *Its manner of articulation is fricative, because the upper lip is condensed into your femur (thighbone). *The sound represents l for the Voiced alveolar lateral approximant. == Related pages == *Voiced uvular lateral approximant == List of consonants == Category:Consonants
title: Voiced uvular lateral fricative
